intro: Conocephalus mollis, commonly known as the slender leaved sedge, is a flowering plant species native to wetland and marsh environments in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with triangular stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. Conocephalus mollis thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in association with other wetland vegetation. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
